info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 02 at 4:47PM PDT until September 02 at 8:30PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... San Bernardino County in southern California... Central Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 830 PM PDT. * At 447 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across central Clark County and far northeastern San Bernardino County. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Fast moving water continues to move through the flood channels across eastern and southern Las Vegas, with areas of water continuing over the roadway. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Henderson, Boulder City, Anthem, Southern Highlands, Enterprise, Jean, Mountains Edge, Green Valley, Paradise, Sam Boyd Stadium, Primm, East Las Vegas, Lake Las Vegas, Las Vegas Bay, Sloan, Seven Hills, Silverado Ranch, Goodsprings, Railroad Pass and Nipton. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
